alert.note: Alert for Coastal Cameron; Coastal Kenedy; Coastal Willacy (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued December 19 at 8:41PM CST until December 19 at 11:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. For the Coastal Flood Statement, isolated minor coastal flooding. * WHERE...Coastal Kenedy, Coastal Cameron and Coastal Willacy Counties. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through Monday afternoon. For the Coastal Flood Statement, until 11 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Wave run-up may approach the dunes along narrow beaches. Beach equipment, such as umbrellas and chairs, could be moved by waves. Vehicles driving along narrow beaches may experience higher water levels. Elevated water levels may also occur across the Laguna Madre and South Bay, and along State Highway 4 west of Boca Chica State Park. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Water levels from SPI Brazos Santiago continue to run about a foot above astronomical predictions, but levels should be decreasing as high tide occurred at 7:22 PM this evening.
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Cameron; Coastal Kenedy; Coastal Willacy
